result.execSummary:
The defendant Viguandi Corona was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Retail Theft - Intentionally Take >$500 - $5000), a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 943.50(1m)(b).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

parties.name: Milwaukee County Clerk of Circuit Court

supervisions.descr: House of Correction - Imposed and Stayed

supervisions.notes:
-Credit for 4 days time served.
-Court has no object to having probation transfered to the State of Illinois

miscConds.notes:
-Defendant to pay Court costs and all applicable surcharges and assessments are to be collected during term of probation
-Defendant is to provide a DNA sample and pay the related surcharge to be collected during term of probation; nonpayment penalty shall result in a civil judgment
-Pay all supervision fees; nonpayment penalty shall be a civil judgment

-No new law violations rising to the level of probable cause
-No alcohol or controlled substances

-Cooperate with any correctional programs recommended
-Cooperate with agent

-AODA assessment and any recommended treatment
-Absolute sobriety with random urine screens and breathalyzers

timeConds.notes: -Defendant to perform 25 hours of community service

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Viguandi Corona

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.
Notice of court ordered financial obligations

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Viguandi Corona in court with attorney Darryl Everett Smith.  Patrick J Anderson appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Sentencing proceeded.  Statements made by State, Defense and Defendant.  The Court sentenced defendant to serve 8 MONTHS, straight time, in the House of Corrections.  Court STAYED sentence and placed the defendant on PROBATION for a period of 1 YEAR, with credit for 4 days time served, with the following conditions:
-Defendant to pay Court costs and all applicable surcharges and assessments are to be collected during term of probation
-Defendant is to provide a DNA sample and pay the related surcharge to be collected during term of probation; nonpayment penalty shall result in a civil judgment
-No new law violations rising to the level of probable cause
-Cooperate with any correctional programs recommended
-Follow all rules of probation
-Pay all supervision fees; nonpayment penalty shall be a civil judgment 
-Cooperate with agent
-Obtain GED or HSED
-AODA assessment and any recommended treatment
-Absolute sobriety with random urine screens and breathalyzers
-No alcohol or controlled substances
-Defendant to perform 25 hours of community service 
-Court has no object to having probation transfered to the State of Illinois

Filed, Notice of Right to Seek Postconviction Relief
Filed, Pretrial Credit sheet

Defendant Viguandi Corona in court with attorney Darryl E. Smith.  Patrick J Anderson appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy court clerk:  vk  Defendant was advised of constitutional rights and maximum penalties, waived all rights, plead GUILTY and was examined as to the plea.  Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights, jury instructions and Addendum received and filed.  Parties stipulate to the complaint as a factual basis for the plea.  Defendant further advised that if he is not a US citizen deportation is possible.  Court found defendant guilty as charged in the Information and withholds entry of Judgment of Conviction.  
Case is adjourned for sentencing in Branch 19.  Sentencing hearing scheduled for March 16, 2016 at 01:30 pm.
Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for 10-07-2015 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Viguandi Corona in court with Attorney Darryl E. Smith.  Thomas Potter, appearing for Patrick J Anderson, appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Defense counsel informs Court they cannot proceed to plea and sentencing on today's date.  State and defense counsel request adjournment.
Court orders case adjourned for plea and sentencing in Branch 19.
Clerk:  jms

Defendant Viguandi Corona in court with attorney Darryl E. Smith.  Patrick J Anderson appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Case in court for Plea/sentencing hearing, however defense requests more time.    All parties are notified that effective August 1, 2015 this case will be assigned to Judge Dennis Cimpl, Branch 19, in Room 313 of the Safety Building due to rotation.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for September 4, 2015 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Viguandi Corona in court with attorney Darryl E. Smith.  Patrick J Anderson appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Case in court for scheduling conference.  Defense requests plea and sentencing date.  Case remains calendared in Branch 22.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for June 29, 2015 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Viguandi Corona in court with attorney Darryl E. Smith.  David Behm on behalf of Patrick J Anderson appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
  Deputy Court Clerk: tmk.
Defendant waived Preliminary Hearing.  Preliminary Hearing Questionnaire and Waiver received and filed.  Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Witkowiak, Branch 22.  Original Information filed.  Copy given to defense counsel who waived reading.  Defendant plead not guilty.  Scheduling conference scheduled for May 6, 2015 at 08:30 am.
Court continued the signature bond that was previously signed in the county jail.

Signed and filed, No Contact Order.  Defendant to have no contact with Kohls Department Store located at S. 76th Street.
Court advised defendant that failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping.

Defendant Viguandi Corona in court with attorney Darryl E. Smith.  Christopher J. Ladwig appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Witkowiak, Branch 22.
Defendant given a copy of complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed complaint and found probable cause to hold defendant for further proceedings.  DEFENDANT DOES QUALIFY FOR PUBLIC DEFENDER REPRESENTATION.   Case is adjourned for preliminary hearing in Branch PE.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for April 2, 2015 at 01:30 pm.
Defendant is Out-of-Custody. Court appearance in Out-Of-Custody Court, Room 221 Safety Building on 3/25/15 @ 1:30pm
